properties.areaDesc: Western Plumas County/Lassen Park; Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 14 at 2:45AM PST until January 14 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento CA
properties.description:
...Mountain travel impacts continue this morning, then increase
again late Wednesday into early Friday...

.Active weather is expected across NorCal this week with a pair
of winter storms bringing rounds of snow to the region. The first
system will continue to result in mountain travel difficulties
this morning.

A wetter and more significant storm is expected later Wednesday
into early Friday. The storm has been trending a bit slower, so
check back for future updates on timing. Overall, this system will
bring moderate to heavy snow to the mountains as well as down
into portions of the upper foothills. Mountain travel during this
time will be very difficult with reduced visibility, chain
controls, and possible road closures. Plan ahead and continue to
monitor the forecast.

* WHAT...Snow occurring. Plan on slippery road conditions.
Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with local
accumulations up to 6 inches, are expected. A Winter Storm Watch
will be in effect from late Wednesday night through late
Thursday night with heavy snow possible. 1 to 2 feet is possible
with locally higher accumulations across the peaks.

* WHERE...Burney Basin / Eastern Shasta County and Western
Plumas County/Lassen Park.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM today. For
the Winter Storm Watch, from late Wednesday night through late
Thursday night.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Be prepared for reduced visibilities at
times. Significant reductions in visibility are possible.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will
cause primarily travel difficulties. Be prepared for snow covered
roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving.
The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

A Winter Storm Watch means there is potential for significant
snow, sleet or ice accumulations that may impact travel. Continue
to monitor the latest forecasts.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
